head.title: The Illusion of Outdoor Living, A Splash Away From Falling Water

hedline.hl1: The Illusion of Outdoor Living, A Splash Away From Falling Water

abstract.p: Eight-thousand-square-foot glass house will be built for John and Ann Bender in San Isidro, Costa Rica; Ismael Leyva is architect; photo (S)

block.p: When John and Ann Bender bought 5,000 acres near San Isidro, Costa Rica, they wanted a transparent home opposite a 600-foot waterfall. ''They want to feel that they are living outside,'' said Ismael Leyva, a Manhattan architect who is designing the 8,000-square-foot house, rendered below. The walls will be glass panels framed by steel cables; there will be nine rooms on five levels, all facing the waterfall, 150 feet away. The translucent woven fiberglass roof will be tensile. Inside, there will be a reflecting pool and water cascading down interior walls. Completion is set for 2002, at a cost of over $2 million.
